page.title: 04Poultry in rural Sowerby.
page.content: Four farms in the area have large poultry units, in which chickens and turkeys are intensively reared in broiler houses. One shed holds several thousand chickens, which remain in the unit for 6_7 weeks. The temperature, air and feed are very carefully controlled. When the birds reach the required weight, they are sent to a nearby processing factory. The units are then cleaned and disinfected by 5 or 6 helpers specially brought in for the job. Turkeys are dealt with in a similar way but take a longer period to fatten. At any one time a farm might be dealing with 76 000 chickens and/or 35 000 turkeys. The poultry industry provides a significant amount of local employment.
